sen.j: 阿羅漢 (あらかん、サンスクリット：arhat)は、仏教において、尊敬や施しを受けるに相応しい聖者のこと。
sen.e: Arakan, arhat in Sanskrit, is a saint who is eligible to receive respect and charity in Buddhism.
Arakan (arhat in Sanskrit) is a saint in Buddhism who is eligible to receive respect and charity.
Arakan (arhat in Sanskrit) is a saint in Buddhism who is eligible to receive respect and charity.

sen.j: サンスクリット語"arhat"の主格"arhan"の音写語。
sen.e: It is a transcript of "arhan", nominative of "arhat" in Sanskrit.
It is a transcript of "arhan," the nominative of "arhat" in Sanskrit.
It is a transcript of "arhan," the nominative of "arhat" in Sanskrit.

sen.j: 略称して羅漢（らかん）ともいう。
sen.e: It is abbreviated to Rakan as well.
It is also abbreviated as Rakan.
It is also abbreviated as Rakan.

sen.j: 漢訳は応供(おうぐ)である。
sen.e: It is translated into 応供 (Ougu) in Chinese.
It is translated into 応供 (Ougu) in Chinese.
It is translated into 応供 (Ougu) in Chinese.

sen.j: もとは釈迦の尊称の一つであった。
sen.e: It was one of the honorific title of Shaka.
It was one of the honorific titles of Shaka.
It was one of the honorific titles of Shaka.

sen.j: 阿羅漢を祀る寺院については、羅漢寺を参照。
sen.e: As to the temples which enshrine Arakan, see Rakan-ji Temple.
For details on the temples that enshrine Arakan, see "Rakan-ji Temple."
For details on the temples that enshrine Arakan, see Rakan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションを取りました。

sen.j: 煩悩の賊(ari)を殺す（han）から殺賊（せつぞく）と言われたり、涅槃に入って迷いの世界（三界）に生れない（a（不）＋ruh（生ずる））から「不生」と言われたりするが、これはいずれも通俗語源解釈である。
sen.e: It is also called 殺賊 (Setsuzoku), transferred from killing (殺す (han)) rebel (賊 (ari)) of earth desires and '不生', transferred from a（不）＋ruh（生ずる） which means not to relive in wandering world (past, present and future existences, three realms) after nirvana, but these are vulgar views on the origin of word.
sen.cmt: 涅槃→英辞郎 on the WEB、三界→Webster's Online Dictionary
sen.e: It is also called 殺賊 (Setsuzoku), transferred from killing (殺す (han)) rebel (賊 (ari)) of earthly desires and '不生,' transferred from a（不）＋ruh（生ずる), which means not to relive in a wandering world (past, present and future existences, or three realms) after nirvana, but these are vulgar views of the origin of word.

It is also called 殺賊 (Setsuzoku), transferred from killing (殺す (han)) rebel (賊 (ari)) of earthly desires and '不生,' transferred from a（不）＋ruh（生ずる), which means not to relive in a wandering world (past, present and future existences, or three realms) after nirvana, but these are vulgar views of the origin of word.

sen.j: 本来は「価値ある」「立派な」などの意味を持つ語根〈arh-〉の派生語である。
sen.e: It is originally a derivative word of the root, arh-, which means 'valuable', 'respectable' and so on.
It is originally a derivative word of the root, arh-, which means 'valuable', 'respectable' and so on.
It is originally a derivative word of the root, arh-, which means 'valuable', 'respectable' and so on.

sen.j: 元々、インドの宗教一般で「尊敬されるべき修行者」をこのように呼んだ。
sen.e: Originally it meant 'respectable disciplinant' in Indian religion generally.
Originally, in the general sense it meant 'respectable disciplinant' in the Indian religion.
Originally, in the general sense it meant 'respectable disciplinant' in the Indian religion.

sen.j: 初期仏教では、修行者の到達し得る最高位をこのように呼ぶ。
sen.e: In the early Buddhism, it meant the top grade which disciplinant could reach.
In early Buddhism it meant the top level that a disciplinant could attain.
In early Buddhism it meant the top level that a disciplinant could attain.

sen.j: 学道を完成し、これ以上に学ぶ要がないので阿羅漢果を「無学位」という。
sen.e: Arakan-ka, state of full attainment of arhatship and being unnecessary to learn any more, is called 'Mugakui (無学位).'
Arakan-ka, the state of full attainment of arhatship in which it isn't necessary to learn any more, is called 'Mugakui (無学位).'
Arakan-ka, the state of full attainment of arhatship in which it isn't necessary to learn any more, is called 'Mugakui (無学位).'

sen.j: それ以下は、不還果・一来果・預流果を「有学」（うがく）位という。
sen.e: As to the grades below that, Fugen-ka, i.e., consummation of the stage of the non-returner, Ichirai-ka, i.e., one who has fully consummated the stage of the once-returner and Yoru-ka, i.e., one who has fully attained the stage of the stream-enterer are called 'Ugakui (有学（うがく）位).'
sen.cmt: 不還果・一来果・預流果→http://www.buddhism-dict.net/ddb/indexes/read-ja-kk.html、有学（うがく）位→定訳不明
sen.e: As for the grades below that, Fugen-ka (the consummation of the stage of the non-returner), Ichirai-ka (one who has fully consummated the stage of the once-returner) and Yoru-ka (one who has fully attained the stage of the stream-enterer) are called 'Ugakui (有学（うがく）位).'

As for the grades below that, Fugen-ka (the consummation of the stage of the non-returner), Ichirai-ka (one who has fully consummated the stage of the once-returner) and Yoru-ka (one who has fully attained the stage of the stream-enterer) are called 'Ugakui (有学（うがく）位).'

sen.j: （四向四果）
sen.e: (Shiko Shika, four accesses and four accomplishments)
(Shiko Shika, four accesses and four accomplishments)
(Shiko Shika, four accesses and four accomplishments)

sen.j: 特に大乗仏教では声聞を阿羅漢と呼び、批判的に仏と区別した。
sen.e: Especially in Mahayana Buddhism, Shomon was called Arakan and was distinguished from Buddha critically.
Especially in Mahayana Buddhism, Shomon was called Arakan and was distinguished from Buddha critically.
Especially in Mahayana Buddhism, Shomon was called Arakan and was distinguished from Buddha critically.

sen.j: しかし、大乗仏教では二乗と呼ばれて、阿羅漢と独覚（どっかく）は「仏」になれないとされた。
sen.e: However, in Mahayana Buddhism it is called two vehicles and Arakan and Dokkaku are said not be able to become 'Buddha.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処、覚（どっかく）→定訳不明
sen.e: However, in Mahayana Buddhism it is referred to as two vehicles, and Arakan and Dokkaku are said to be unable to become 'Buddha.'
However, in Mahayana Buddhism it is referred to as two vehicles, and Arakan and Dokkaku are said to be unable to become 'Buddha.'

sen.j: さらには「地獄」へも堕ちることができず、その位のまま輪廻が繰り返されるとする論書さえある。
sen.e: In addition, there is a theory that they can not even go to 'hell' and repeat reincarnation at the same grade.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, there is a theory that they cannot even go to 'Hell' but must repeat reincarnation at the same level.
Additionally, there is a theory that they cannot even go to 'Hell' but must repeat reincarnation at the same level.

sen.j: 中国・日本では仏法を護持することを誓った16人の弟子を十六羅漢と呼び尊崇した。
sen.e: In China and Japan, 16 disciples who sworn to keep Buddhism were called Sixteen Rakans and respected.
In China and Japan, 16 disciples who swore to keep Buddhism were respected as "the 16 rakans."
In China and Japan, 16 disciples who swore to keep Buddhism were respected as the 16 Rakans.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションを取り、羅漢を大文字に。

sen.j: また、第1回の仏典編集（結集（けつじゅう））に集まった500人の弟子を五百羅漢と称して尊敬することも盛んであった。
sen.e: Moreover, 500 disciples who gathered in the first editorial meeting of Buddhism sutra (結集（けつじゅう） were called Five hundreds Rakans and respected eagerly.
sen.cmt: 結集（けつじゅう） 定訳不明
sen.e: Moreover, 500 disciples who gathered in the first editorial meeting of Buddhism sutra (結集（けつじゅう） were called the 500 rakans and were eagerly respected.
Moreover, 500 disciples who gathered in the first editorial meeting of Buddhist sutra (結集（けつじゅう）were called the 500 Rakans and were eagerly respected.

sen.j: ことに禅宗では阿羅漢である大迦葉に釈迦の正法が直伝されたことを重視して、釈迦の弟子たちの修行の姿が理想化され、五百羅漢図や羅漢像が作られ、正法護持の祈願の対象となった。
sen.e: Zen sect especially emphasized that Shaka's true dharma (正法) was transmitted directly to Arakan, Daikasho (Mahakasyapa) and produced pictures of Five hundreds Rakans and statues of Rakan idealized the figures of Shaka's disciples training, which were worshipped to pray for keeping true dharma later.

Particularly, the Zen sect emphasized that Shaka's true dharma (正法) was transmitted directly to Arakan, Daikasho (Mahakasyapa) and produced pictures of the 500 rakans, and statues of Rakan idealized the figures of Shaka's disciples training, which were later worshipped to pray for keeping true dharma.

Particularly, the Zen sect emphasized that Shaka's true dharma (正法) was transmitted directly to Arakan, Daikasho (Mahakasyapa) and produced pictures of the 500 Rakans, and statues of Rakan idealized the figures of Shaka's disciples training, which were later worshipped to pray for keeping true dharma.

sen.j: 大阿羅漢難提多所説（法注記）によると、仏勅を受けて永くこの世に住し衆生を済度する役割をもった16人の阿羅漢といわれる。
sen.e: According to Daiarakan Nandai Shosetsu (Hojuki), it means sixteen Arakans who live in this world forever by Buddha's order and play a role of redemption of the living things.
According to "Daiarakan Nandai Shosetsu (Hojuki)," it means sixteen arakans who live in this world forever by Buddha's order and serve the role of redeemers of living things.
According to "Daiarakan Nandai Shosetsu (Hojuki)," it means sixteen Arakans who live in this world forever by Buddha's order and serve as redeemers of living things.

sen.j: 後に、賓頭盧を別の羅漢として、十六羅漢思想を創始したとされる慶友とあわせ十八羅漢とする場合もある。
sen.e: There is a view which includes Binzuru as another Rakan into Eighteen Rakans with Keiyu, who is regarded to begin the idea of Eighteen Rakans.
There is a view that includes Binzuru as another rakan among "the 18 rakans" with Keiyu, who is regarded as having originated the idea of the 18 rakans.
